subject: Using junit to test swing gui
msgSnippet: Hi, Does anyone have advice on using JUnit as an aid to coding and testing a Swing gui? I m just starting to learn Swing and JUnit and I m wondering if it s
messageBody:
Hi,
Does anyone have advice on using JUnit as an aid to coding and
testing a Swing gui?

I'm just starting to learn Swing and JUnit and I'm wondering if it's
possible to simulate an event, such as a menu selection or a button
click, in my test case and fire it at the gui class under test, and
then test the result.

Thank you.
